review.title: Evaluation of the Accuracy of the BGLemmatizer
review.abstract: This paper reveals the results of an analysis of the accuracy of developed software for automatic lemmatization for the Bulgarian language. This lemmatization software is written entirely in Java and is distributed as a GATE plugin. Certain statistical methods are used to define the accuracy of this software. The results of the analysis show 95% lemmatization accuracy.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: The entry for "lemmatize" in the Collins English Dictionary states that lemmatization is the process of grouping the various flexed forms of a word so that they can be analyzed as a single term (Collins English Dictionary1). Lemmatization is a fundamental task of natural language processing (NLP), which automates the process of word normalization. Correctly identifying the normalized form of a word is important for NLP tasks such as gathering and gathering information.
